website_summaries.verdict: Versatile boat carrier that can fit all sizes, shapes, and weights.
pros: Option to carry one kayak in a J cradle position or two in a stacker position
Comes with tie downs and straps so you don't need to purchase anything extra
Folds down when not in use
cons: This is the most expensive item on our list

customer_reviews.title: Great mount, whisteling can be stopped easy enough.
customer_reviews.text: They work great and look great, being able to fold them down so that I can get in and out of my small garage is fantastic as well. Been functionally using them for a few months now with no issues. However, they did whistle. After some trial and error found that there is one particular screw hole that was making the noise on the front. The back mount was not whistleing because the aero bars caused the mount's screw hole to not be parallel with the ground. A little electrical tape over the hole(pictured) was all the was needed to silence it!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack, but keep an eye on its wear and tear
customer_reviews.text: There are many things we like about this rack - good price, foldable, good for two kayaks, lockable, and overall looks decent. Unfortunately, one of the pieces developed a crack on the base of the loading skid from front to back, rendering it unsafe to use. This was after after a combined (approximately) 40 hours at highway speeds (around a dozen trips, in less than a year). We are currently trying to return the broken piece and will use a replacement, although we will also keep an eye on wear and tear. We really don't want to have any incident with boat(s) on top at higher speeds!
customer_reviews.author: A L

customer_reviews.title: These are great. Was able to get 4 kayaks on my ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Was able to get 4 kayaks on my Subaru outback using two of these and one of the stackers in the middle. I used to have yakimas more expensive j cradles and they were not as good in my opinion on the yakima round bar. They rotated more than these did. I have a couple heavy kayaks on these a pamlico tandem and a tarpon 140. I would buy these again
customer_reviews.author: trs80

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, great rack
customer_reviews.text: I have two sets of these racks now, and they cradle both of our kayaks perfectly! They are good for multiple sizes of kayaks, and fold down when not in use to give extra clearance. The racks are very easy to install and remove.
customer_reviews.author: DTrot

customer_reviews.title: Excellent racks!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 4 sets of these, and they are great all around. Except for the whistling(easy fix), they are perfect for me. I like that they lock, and the lock is in a METAL surrounding. I tried a set of Thule Hull A Port XT's, and they are POORLY designed, the lock is no where as good as these. The clamps on these go around the bar where the Thule ones didn't and could be twisted and removed easily even when locked. Yakima definitely does great with these. The straps that come with them are also really good. Very solid and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my Honda CRV!
customer_reviews.text: 2019 Honda CRV & Guster Emotion 10.5 footer. Works great! At first I was skeptical but once they locked into place I was convinced. Setup was easy, have loaded and carried my kayak several times with confidence. Don't tell anyone - it's so secure I stopped using fore and aft lines when driving the local area (under 55 mph) with no slippage at all. Bought and installed the optional keywords so they don't walk off in downtown. Glad I got these!!
customer_reviews.author: hnlramprat

customer_reviews.title: This rack is a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I've had a cheaper rack that you have to screw on the car rack. I dreaded installing them. This option is a lifesaver. I used it only once so far and it was a breeze to install and put tie the kayak on. The fact it folds down when it is not being used is also a excellent feature. Who knows about it's longevity and durability but so far I love it.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit for my Subaru 2016 Outback
customer_reviews.text: I bought this carrier because it was recommended by the Yakima website for my 2016 Subaru Outback with the factory crossbars. I had no problems installing on the crossbar on the front of the vehicle, but when I tried to install on the rear crossbar the carrier kept tilting to the left. I called Yakima support and all they could tell me was that it was supposed to be a universal fit. The customer service guy was no help at all. I doubt I will be buying any Yakima items in the future after this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Asil915

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best kayak j-cradles on the market
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to mount a third boat on my Yakima Rack and roll trailer. These mount very solidly on the smaller Yakima bars, unlike many cheaper J-cradles that tend to flip over. They include two sets of tie downs. Expensive, but probably the best J cradle on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Boomstick

customer_reviews.title: The problem with these is they whistle quite loud when folded down
customer_reviews.text: This kayak carrier is great in every way except one really important one. The whole point of having ones that folds down is you can leave it on you vehicle, folded down, while not in use. The problem is they whistled I bought a wind deflector to mount in front of them and I've tried these on two other vehicles and every time they whistle quite a bit and super loud at times.
customer_reviews.author: Craig S. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with Racks
customer_reviews.text: The Yakima JayLow Racks came on time and in perfect shape. I was surprised because we've been attempting to find some all summer and these were ordered and came within the time frame promised. They were super easy to install and we had our kayaks on the racks, tied down, and going to the river in no time.
customer_reviews.author: R Ross

customer_reviews.title: and I just want to publish an initial review of how easily these went on
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 sets of these for my 15 Outback, and I just want to publish an initial review of how easily these went on! It took a second to make sense of the pictures (there is nothing written) but by the 2nd unit, I was a pro. They arrived a day earlier than I expected, and I can't be happier. I will be taking them for a loaded run on Thursday, and will update this review if needed. I did pay attention to the previous reviewers and taped with Gorilla tape, all the little screw holes on the bottom of the cradle, so I hope that takes care of any problems.
customer_reviews.author: RQ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and functional.
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of recreational kayaks and needed something simple to transport them with. This rack did just that, they were easy to install on my Whispbar rack and hooking up the kayaks was simple. My only complaint is that when I choose to leave them on the rack without the kayaks, they make a whistle that is somewhat annoying. But, since it is easy to take them off and put them on it really isn't that big of a deal. I would definitely recommend the product for someone looking to haul kayaks around.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rack!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Yakima rack. While not cheap, they are high quality and go a great job of securing my boat. I really like the JayLow folding feature which eliminates a lot of wind noise. If you are an avid kayaker- this is the rack to get.
customer_reviews.author: Terence Schrider

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Just received my new jay low racks today and had them installed on my thule truck rack in less than 10 minutes. Nothing to assemble. Just figure out where you want them and put them on. Awesome racks. Very well made. Now I know why they cost so much. Definitely worth the price for me. I also bought the locks and they went on even quicker than the racks. I test fit my kayak and it went up lickety split. If you are on the fence about what to buy I highly recommend them. Also, I checked the pricing everywhere and Amazon had the best price by $20-30.
customer_reviews.author: skypilot

customer_reviews.title: broken
customer_reviews.text: used one time and the front piece was broken had to have someone get my wife. Yes It was put together right I found a crack in the flip and it snapped. last time we went out. Gonna try and see what others ones are out there that work
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Steinour

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome! First time kayak owner and bought two sets ...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! First time kayak owner and bought two sets to carry 3 kayaks on my Forester. Was concerned about space but after extensive research decided on these. There was zero slack and nothing worked loose. I highly recommend shutting the strap end in the doors, keeps them even more secure. No shifting, no movement. I felt incredibly secure at 65 mph for 1 1/2 hour drive!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These things work just like they say they should and I for one think ...
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how they could have managed to mess up such a simple, fool proof design and they sure didn't. These things work just like they say they should and I for one think you could even transport non kayaks in a pinch. I don't have a kayak but I know some folks who do and if they ever invite me, I wanted to have a way to help transport and help out, pull my load. Haven't used them yet but I'll update if I get the chance to and let you know how they work out.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Paine

customer_reviews.title: Why is it so expensive? Why aren't there locks included?
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize it lacked key locks which I thought would be standard. While I do enjoy it's convenience of folding down and straight up for 2 kayaks (if needed) I don't like the struggle undoing the red latches; requires some strength without solid leverage. The price was also what had me waiting on it since - afterwards I saw a pair for a 1/3 from a different no-name brand; goes to show you I'm paying more for the 6 letters than the actual tool.
customer_reviews.author: Random_Zander

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, dependable kayak cradle
customer_reviews.text: Love this cradle. Super easy to use (after putting up and taking down our 2 kayaks several times to find a rhythm). Wish the SKS core locks came with it but I bought those two weeks later for peace of mind and so I don’t have to lock them in the bed after taking the yaks down 😁 I like the build quality and the support it offers the kayak. The ability to load a second yak alongside it is nice, I still add a layer of support to my crossbars in the form of two cutouts of foam pipe insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Albano

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, annoying whistle!
customer_reviews.text: Installed in less than 10 minutes—worst thing so far is the whistling! Whenever I get above 30 MPH there’s a super annoying whistle that I can hear even over my radio (and I don’t hear well). They look great though, and the work well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great kayak rack
customer_reviews.text: These kayak racks are easy to install, securely hold boats, and can be quickly removed when not in use, but also fold down so as to reduce road/wind noise. We bought two -- one for each boat -- although friends haul two boats back to back on a vertical upright. One criticism was a whistle on the road (without specifying whether up or down); we had no problems with whistling. And those we bought through Amazon were significantly less than local sporting goods stores,
customer_reviews.author: Rapidsrider

customer_reviews.title: Cool rack for moving kayak
customer_reviews.text: Cool rack for moving kayak. Get locking cores while ordering to secure this beauty to car. If you have other yakima stuff like me get matching key cores so one key opens all the stuff. Yakima has good quality material in the stuff. I would not leave on the car for an extended period of time because the home padding will break down in the sun. The straps are of good quality having a rubber coating so not to rub on boards or boats.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Put a tandem kayak on a Toyota Camry and drove 60MPH
customer_reviews.text: Did not fall off! Really sturdy, I was really impressed how secure it was on the highway. Fantastic value.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Good but noisy when stowed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install on the cross bars, easy enough to use. The locking lever doesn't feel too sturdy, but my real issue is that when they are not loaded with a kayak or other toy, and folded flat (to get in and out of parking garages) the wind whistle is really annoying. High pitched whine while driving. I had to take them off between uses, and that is not something my wide wants to have to do when she wants to run to the lake with the kids.
customer_reviews.author: MAN

customer_reviews.title: Quick/Easy and secure
customer_reviews.text: I have now used this rack several times. Both with a single yak setup and and a 2 yak setup. This rack does it both single and dual yak setups very well. Though the dual yak set up is a little cumbersome, it works and is very secure. I even was driving with 2 yaks in a very windy storm and They stayed up there no problem. If you strap the yaks down like the instructions say so and use the bow and stern straps. You will have no problem!! Its a bit more expensive than some of the other racks but I already had Yakima roof mounted bike racks, so I wanted the locks/keys to match up with those.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Brown

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: It worked as described and held my kayaks on while driving 65mph. I only purchased one set and it worked for two kayaks.
customer_reviews.author: Warren S Huffaker

customer_reviews.title: Go for the best to start!
customer_reviews.text: We tried several other cheaper brands of carriers and returned them due to awkward installation, less than snug fit on crossbars, etc. As retirees on a set budget, we finally decided to spend the money and buy two pairs of these carriers.... for quality, better fit/installation, and easier use with our 2 liquidlogic Marvel 10, sit-in kayaks. They work great on our Jeep or Toyota Highlander. We definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: easy to attach clamp from side onto crossbar
customer_reviews.text: I have only put them on factory cross bars without a kayak so far. They appear to be good, the vertical folding arm was a bit loose, but turning the red clamp seemed to tighten it up. The clamping mechanism is really nice and easy to use, but that could also be a quick way for another to quickly remove and walk away with it. It came with everything that you would need, even if you have round crossbars.
customer_reviews.author: smartin

customer_reviews.title: Easiest install, plus great boat stability
customer_reviews.text: This kayak rack installs fast, ten minutes and you are ready. Once the kayak is strapped in, it is not ever going to come loose, it attaches to the rack,tightly, until you remove it. The base has a non slip rubbery surface, that the boat sticks firmly to. The rack is very heavy duty. The style. like a saddle, holds it in place. Best of all, this rack is designed to allow you to lift half of the kayak into the saddle and lift the other half into place. Allowing this 70 year older a way to get a 46lb. kayak onto my car. A great product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very slick kayak carrier
customer_reviews.text: These kayak carriers fit perfect on my very deep aerodynamic Audi cross bars, and look very slick. The only drawback seems to be the whistling, which I followed another reviewers recommendation to cover up the bottom holes with black duct tape, and that made them silent. When in use it is very sturdy and the straps are long enough for any type of kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Petter

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy product with a whistle
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I would give it five stars however the whistle sound is so annoying. I am surprised that the company has not responded these comments about how they can improve their product to help resolve this.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! We bought two of them to carry two kayak for our 2010 Grand Jeep Cherokee. Works on our factory mounted luggage racks. One holder will hold both kayaks, but it is easier to hoist one kayak up on the car on either side instead of trying to push both up on one side, especially if you are not the tallest person.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this J rack system
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this J rack system. The best part about the Jaylow set is that you can put the cradles vertical and make it a stacker for multiple kayaks on your vehicle. The system works well with my aeroblade rhino rack roof rack system and I have never had any issues with my kayaks while traveling 70+ mph. These are good quality and for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Best feature is the fold down capability.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these as they replaced my older Yakima J cradles that didn't fold down. I used to have to force the older ones back to clear my garage doors but these make it simple...just unlatch, fold down and that's it..lots of clearance now. I have an older set of round Yakima bars...if you're buying everything from scratch, get square bars. These new ones, although much better, still can rotate a little on round bars. I use them with my 17 ft CLC Cheasapeake wood kayak and they hold it securely and safely.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Dan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM
customer_reviews.text: Great quality they work perfectly an fold down when not in use , took 10 mins to install . Buy the locks for them because someone will walk off with them they are great but them !!!
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with these kayak carriers. I was hesitant to purchase them because of the price and I did a lot of research first. While a few reviews complained about plastic pieces breaking off of these, they still seemed to be the best purchase. We ended up getting two sets so that we can carry two kayaks at once. It was a great purchase! We ended up getting the yakima locking devices with keys so that we can leave these on the car at all times (and lock them on to prevent theft). They look great! Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Emily C Warren

customer_reviews.title: Could be designed to hold kayak better while loading/unloading
customer_reviews.text: Had older solid, non-folding Yakima J-Racks. Style easier to load and unlaod kayaks. These, though fold, and need when driving into all Boston parking garages, are easier to put on, take off, have locks, and fold. BUT, kayak can easily slip off while loading. Damaged my outside mirror.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Pilla

customer_reviews.title: The best.
customer_reviews.text: Top quality like everything else in the Yakima line. Sure, you spend more initially, but you'll appreciate the quality and durability over time. One less thing to worry about, and you can get on with having fun!
customer_reviews.author: Robert O.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, amazing customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The product is great. Holds kayaks with confidence. Easy to setup. I had an issue with one of the bars bending back and cracking a part of the plastic. Contacted Yakima on the phone about the issue. I sent them my order number and a picture of the crack. That same day I received a order number from Yakima. A few days later I had a brand new Yakima rack. Unbelievable. Customer service was beyond what I would have ever expected. Very fast and simple process. In a world where customer service continues to decline, Yakama and John (phone representative) did an exceptional job. I will always use Yakima products based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality. I like the plastic part on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. I like the plastic part on the end to slide the kayak on the rack. I wish these are cheaper so I can buy two of them. We have two kayaks and even though it can take two kayaks, it's a little difficult making sure the first one stays on while we put the second one on.If you're planning to move this on and off a lot it's not very difficult, but I bruised my knuckles tightening it on the crossbar, you just have to turn it a dozen times or so. Not really a big deal even if you have to move it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Maz

customer_reviews.title: This rack is great for securing my kayaks to my SUV
customer_reviews.text: This rack is great for securing my kayaks to my SUV. Easy enough to lift them to the bottom of the rack, then push them up to vertical position before strapping them down. No need for the front or rear straps when used locally--the belly straps are plenty secure--but I would and did use them for a long trip on highways. Love being able to easily fold down the rack so I can still park in my garage. And not to much trouble to take them off during the winter, though I wouldn't want to do it regularly. Hence, the fold down convenience. All in all, a great product and recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Todd VandenAkker

customer_reviews.title: These folding kayak cradles are really nice. We bought two sets to haul two kayaks ...
customer_reviews.text: These folding kayak cradles are really nice. We bought two sets to haul two kayaks at a time. You have to make sure that you run the straps through the up-righted loops in the cradle and drap the excess where you can reach it before you put the kayak on the cradle. Once you do that you can grab it and flip it to the front of the kayak for tying down.
customer_reviews.author: Love to Learn

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect...  Better than the rest.
customer_reviews.text: Yet another 5-star review for a 4.5-star product based purely on the fact that, while an imperfect rack; it's the best option available on the market... It just makes sense to me that this thing would be adaptable for the second kayak so that you don't have to put it directly on your bars... I feel like engineers (and Yamika) missed out on a chance at the perfect rack and an easy extra $70...
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mount to my Lexus LX 470 cross bars ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mount to my Lexus LX 470 cross bars and holds my OT Predator MX well. Make sure you conduct a couple of stops/checks while you drive as everything has a tendency to settle in through the bumps on the road, wind, etc. just recheck tension of straps and everything will be fine. The carrier and straps are well designed and easy to place and remove if needed. The racks fold down and store fairly flat if you decide to leave it mounted to the roof rack. There are plenty of You Tube videos on how to install and use this system.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Moody

customer_reviews.title: Whistling sound
customer_reviews.text: These racks are great. Easy to install and only one problem that was easily resolved. When driving at low and high speed I heard a whistling sound. Easily fixed by putting gorilla tape over factory holes in bottom of racks. Very quiet now and couldn’t be happier with product.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Two kayaks loaded by myself, second set of straps not included
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy install. Only thing is the kit doesn't come with a second set of tie downs, so I had to buy those to haul a second kayak
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: I think it's better than the Hull a port pro.
customer_reviews.text: This rack is a lot better than what I was expecting. I own the thule hull a port pro and bought this as a cheaper version of what i have for my mom. I like it so much better I'm going to sell my hull a port pro and buy one of these. I like that you can lock it to the car. You can not do the same with thule and you pay $30 more. Its really the same as the hull a port pro but you save $30 and it can be locked on to car. The locking feature makes the difference for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kristofor

customer_reviews.title: I consider that bad design but now have to deal with a broken ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed fast and goes well with our Yakima Skybox. The only issue we had was as I was tying the craft down, accidentally pulled through the rubber loop and it broke. I consider that bad design but now have to deal with a broken loop on the buckle on one of the straps. The cradles are great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: The best kayak rack on the market. Easy on and off. They fit Xterra cross bars excellent. Added the SKS lock cores for added security. I have two sets for both our boats and they fit fine on our Xterra. They will also clamp to a 2X4 on my little trailer.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, works great.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for installation are not simple. Takes a little patience to install. Works great, sturdy. Did cause some wind noise to the car.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda S Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome racks!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! Fold down flat when not in use, and offer fairly low wind noise at highway speeds. Other people mention whistling, but I have yet to hear any. I truly think that it depends on the vehicle build/style and location on the roof. I've driven many miles at interstate speeds with zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: 2 minute hardware install, kayak is completely tight to car
customer_reviews.text: This rack is incredible. 1/2 minutes to screw on each piece to the roof. Instructions crystal clear. Straps highest quality and rubber tipped so you don’t scratch your car paint. If you follow the directions the kayak won’t move one bit. Just used for first time and I’ve never had my kayak so tightly secured to my car. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: E M

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price. We bought two sets (one for each kayak) even though you can technically put two kayaks up with one set. Very easy to install. Easy to use. Kayaks fit very securely. Only complaint I have is the "S" hooks would be better served to be rubber coated, at least on the ends, which is what we did by buying a rubber coating product. My car has several miniature scratches from the S hooks.
customer_reviews.author: Former Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Product
customer_reviews.text: One of the J-Cradles does not stay locked and falls down with very little pressure. Under the right set of circumstances, this fault could lead to the kayak falling off the rack while traveling. I have requested a replacement rack from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mount, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Took five days to get to me on my Prime order, but whatever, these things are great. Super easy to mount in comparison with others I've tried *cough*Swiss Cargo*cough*; easy to adjust as well. Holds tightly to my factory Jeep rails. I appreciate the protective sleeve on the bow/stern tie-down straps.
customer_reviews.author: Mad_Monk

customer_reviews.title: They hold my 13' kayak just fine, with no issues for trips up to several ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I've had these on / off my truck multiple times. The quality and fit is what I was expecting, so nothing extraordinary there. They hold my 13' kayak just fine, with no issues for trips up to several hundred miles. If I buy a second kayak, I would buy a second set, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Legit kayak racks
customer_reviews.text: Excellent racks for your kayak, super easy load and unload from the side of your car, and just as easy to take off your roof racks or fold down when not in use. I recommend buying locks to secure them to your roof racks if you plan on leaving them on in sketchy areas for extended periods of time (two twist knobs close a clamp around the roof rack bars, takes about 15 seconds to take them off)
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dlhopolsky

customer_reviews.title: I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.text: My kayak seems very stable and secure in these J-racks! Got this because it says it can hold 2 kayaks. We tried but it seemed better to just lay the second kayak on the roof rook. But these are very easy to install and uninstall so you don't have to leave them on your rack when not in use. I'm happy with my purchase. Have used several times for long distance trips now with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: H. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my 2019 Subaru Outback. I have used it several time hauling my Perception Captiva 16 that weight 58 lbs. I have no trouble at all. Very well built and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Rich6973

customer_reviews.title: Good for loading solo.
customer_reviews.text: I mainly got these because I kayak solo and need to have a way to get my kayak up on my car without a second person. I am using these with a Whispbar roof rack attached to my Toyota Corolla. I am a medium sized female who goes kayaking solo and I can lift my kayak(40lbs) up onto these without too much difficulty. I am able to lift the stern up to sit on one end of the cradle then lift the bow up without the kayak slipping off. So far no complaints
customer_reviews.author: AvidRunner

customer_reviews.title: Over all decent.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for one sit on top kayak and it worked really well. I have also used this for two kayaks back to back and that was very sketchy. The flip down feature works nicely. The end straps for securing the kayak left black rubbing marks in the paint on the hood of my car.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie R.

customer_reviews.title: Best Kayak rack!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Kayak rack. These are exactly as the description explained. They are heavy duty while being light weight and easy to install. They are very stable in the transport of my kayak and when not in use the fold down and stay secure. So very Happy with this product purchase
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to take on and off your car. Well built. My only wish was that they would have some sort of locking system, like a key or something, so that there’s no chance of ppl stealing them off your car.
customer_reviews.author: Runner girl

customer_reviews.title: Installation
customer_reviews.text: Just rec'd today and installed in minutes, incredibly easy to place on your rack!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I really like these a lot. Went on much faster than cheaped J-carriers and no noticable noise folded down (even at 80 mph). I would recommend getting the sks locks since these are pricey and can be removed easily. Worth the price to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy use and install
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on my 2018 Chevy Trax and Yakima round bars. Extremely easy to install and to use - the round bar adapter works extremely well and the ledge makes loading the kayaks easy. I bought this style to carry two kayaks and it is very easy to use when I load both kayaks. The only minor complaint is they DO make A LOT of air noise above 35 MPH when the kayaks are not loaded. I am very happy with my Yakima Jaylow and I have happily purchased more Yakima products since buying these!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: It was so easy to install. I'm really glad it can be folded down when I'm not using it. I bought it for the versatility, - either one kayak or two! I am hearing a pronounced whistle when I'm driving but part of that is from is my new cross bars. It's not really a problem because I can take the whole assembly off in ten minutes or less. Lovin' it!
customer_reviews.author: Kayakin' Hippie

customer_reviews.title: best kayak rack on the market.
customer_reviews.text: This rack makes traveling with 2 kayaks and a paddle board a breeze! We bought it two years ago and we still love it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Birth

customer_reviews.title: Securely holds my kayak, it can be difficult to lift a kayak onto the rack at this angle alone
customer_reviews.text: This perfectly and securely holds my kayak! I have this on top of my Toyota Rav4. I am a smaller build female and I cannot lift my kayak onto this rack on my own. Take this into consideration when purchasing this roof rack.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie O

customer_reviews.title: Works well but they make a lot of noise when driving at higher speeds.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, looks good and work well, but not very wind resistant when they're closed. Maybe other rooftop racks have the same problem but I'm looking forward to the end of the summer when I can remove these so I will no longer hear the wind howling when I drive down the highway.
customer_reviews.author: sloopjont

customer_reviews.title: Great racks but some wind noise
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install / remove. Seems solid for use with my 10' kayak. High quality rubberized straps. Some wind noise (annoying whistle between 40 and 50 mph) though, otherwise would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Work great on my Yakmia rooftop bar
customer_reviews.text: Work great on my Yakmia rooftop bar. Very sturdy and held 2 kayaks when i set the bar 90 degree. As mentioned on some other posts that there is a whistle sound when you hit certain speed. What I did was use gorilla tape to cover the holes at the bottom of each unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kenshin Vu

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2013 Toyota RAV4 perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, much easier to install than other universal j racks. Feels a lot more sturdier than most other brands I've use. It's a little more pricier than other brand but its worth it. The best feature I like about these are that they fold down when not being used. I bought one but will eventually buy another one for my second kayak down the road. I would recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: CYang

customer_reviews.title: No fuss, solid support.
customer_reviews.text: Cradle installs and removes easily on my 2015 Subaru Outback. It takes only a couple of minutes to set up and provides solid support for my 12' recreational kayak. A single cradle can be used to transport two kayaks with a little more effort in strapping them down.
customer_reviews.author: QuinnFam

customer_reviews.title: but the fold down feature is great while vacationing
customer_reviews.text: They are a little pricey, but the fold down feature is great while vacationing. The tightening mechanism for the uprights are awkward and I am a little disappointed in that design, but the clamps to the car rack are great and much better than this non-folfing version I was using.
customer_reviews.author: FnS

customer_reviews.title: One sets of racks works for two kayaks!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to transport two kayaks. No where was it stated that only one set was all you need,... so now have to deal with returning some parts, and keeping others. (Straps still needed for second kayak—but those can be ordered separately).
customer_reviews.author: Beachgurl

customer_reviews.title: They work great. The bottoms are rubber lined to help hold ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these in conjunction with the Yakima Q towers and round bars. They work great. The bottoms are rubber lined to help hold the kayak/ canoe in place. One set of these can hold 2 kayaks but having 2 sets makes unloading/ loading a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Monticue

customer_reviews.title: aren't as sturdy as I'd like either
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. It's quite hard to get my boat, Wilderness 120, up on these sideways, even using a boat roller on the rear window. The arms, once upright, aren't as sturdy as I'd like either, they have movement in them after some use.
customer_reviews.author: Debby Karalee

customer_reviews.title: Only straps for one kayak
customer_reviews.text: Good rack so far. 3 stars for not including the extra straps for two kayaks. Wasn’t made clear in description the provided straps are for only one kayak. Expect better for a $200 product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great rack ;)
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our kayak and can add our paddle board to other side.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Just what we expected
customer_reviews.text: This fit the bill for our Subaru. The whistling is a problem. We taped the hole that supposedly makes the noise, not sure if that fixed it. Don't really notice it anymore. (turn up the music)lol Quick shipping & came just as advertized.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's good it can be fixed on without any tools and ...
customer_reviews.text: I use my Yakima rack on a Subaru Forester with a whitewater boat (Jackson All Star) and it works well. It's good it can be fixed on without any tools and seems to clamp on well assuming your fingers can get it tight enough. I've only tried 1 kayak though it claims 2 can be carried from one rack. In general I'd recommend this. Seems a nice design and works.
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily while carrying a kayak - DONT' BUY.
customer_reviews.text: This broke when I had my 45 pound kayak on it. The kayak fell on top of the car. No one got injured. AMAZON, stop selling this product. The plastic is extremely low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Asli S.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy on/off. This is the best Kayak rack I ...
customer_reviews.text: This rack is quality. Very easy on/off. This is the best Kayak rack I have ever owned. Other sets make you use wrenches to install, which is time consuming. Its More expensive than cheap sets, but your getting what you pay for here. Worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: wizzard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kayak rack
customer_reviews.text: Awesome kayak rack. Super easy to install and the ability to lay down flat when not in use is super convenient. Best kayak rack I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Rose

customer_reviews.title: Too much
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these. It is simple, solid and sturdy. And fits all my bars, aero to square. But for almost $200? Ridiculous amount to pay for a kayak rack. (It was half that a year or so ago). I can go through a lot of cheap racks for that.
customer_reviews.author: rossssssss

customer_reviews.title: well made and carries a 16' kayak well
customer_reviews.text: Pricey, but works well. carries my kayak just fine. I like that it comes with the tie down straps also. A good quality product. I also bought their locks for this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Gorga

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but Fits All My Racks
customer_reviews.text: Great rack. Folds flat when not in use. Holds even my hard chine wood boat securely. Arm can be locked upright to load and secure boats on both sides of the rack. The mount fits my Yakima round bars as well as the aero cross arms on two of my factory racks; really handy if you haul on more than one vehicle or occasionally on a trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There is a good bit of noise if I open the sunroof
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 sets of these on my CRV, and they allow me to carry 3 boats on top. I've never worried about them moving while properly secured. There is a good bit of noise if I open the sunroof, but that is expected. Definitely not a deterrent.
customer_reviews.author: PigPen4x4

customer_reviews.title: Noisy no returns Yakima
customer_reviews.text: Too noisy when not using. I tried to return but they said no I paid $200 who wants for $100 Brand new Jersey joel dot com
customer_reviews.author: joel kamenoff

customer_reviews.title: 2thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Great rack. Really easy to install and use. Mine got damaged in a car accident, and Yakima easily replaced them at no cost. Thanks Yakima!
customer_reviews.author: John M Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Like these much better than the old Thules we used. Much easier to install and I'm more confident that they'll stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: MLR

customer_reviews.title: ideal for shallow or thin kayaks.
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for one slim kayak. I found my new 2017 Sun Dolphin was to deep to fit correctly. I really liked the build and design but in the end my kayak didn't; fir.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Hisey

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to
customer_reviews.text: I got these because you can attach two kayaks instead of just one. Works great and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Mary B

customer_reviews.title: Great Kayak Cradle
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cradle. Highly recommended...I've mounted two boats to a single set and it travels very well. The JayLow is easy to mount on round or aero-bars, and it folds for use when not hauling boats. It does produce a whistle at highway speeds when folded.
customer_reviews.author: ECF

customer_reviews.title: Great racks!
customer_reviews.text: These work great! I have tried many different racks over the years and these are by far the best and I love that they fold down when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Losli

customer_reviews.title: and they were secure and worked great!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two sets of these for our two kayaks. We used them a few times this summer, and they were secure and worked great!
customer_reviews.author: MamaB

customer_reviews.title: I read a lot of horror stories about the weak factory rack but so far so good. I considered the BowDown model but like the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to fit our 2010 Outback. I read a lot of horror stories about the weak factory rack but so far so good. I considered the BowDown model but like the double clamps on the JayLow. They fit great with the oval shaped factory cross bars. The main straps are much longer than needed but could easily be cut shorter. The end straps worked fine and come with a section of protective tubing. Our first trip with our 17' boat was over 1300 miles at speeds up to 75 MPH and again, no problems. I plan to get a second boat and a another JayLow.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: A total piece of junk. It malfunctioned and caused near catastrophe on the Interstate. Don’t buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D. Smith

product_meta.title: YAKIMA - JayLow Rooftop Mounted Kayak Rack for Vehicles, Carries Up to 2 Kayaks
product_meta.description: There may be divas on your road trip, but this boat carrier is very low maintenance. With multiple settings, the JayLow allows you to carry one boat in J-Cradle position, 2 boats in vertical position plus folds down when not in use. Weight: 11.00 lbs. Dimensions: L 6.69 in x W 6.00 in x H 20.00 in.
feature_bullets: CARRY UP TO 2 KAYAKS: Fits 1 kayak in J-cradle position (up to 80 lbs.) or 2 kayaks in a vertical, stacked position (up to 110 lbs. combined)
FITS MOST CROSSBARS: Compatible with Yakima SteamLine and round, square, factory and aerodynamic crossbars; Minimum crossbar spread of 24"
INCLUDES STRAPS: Includes all the necessary hardware and straps (Heavy-Duty Straps and Bow/Stern Tie-Downs) to secure your gear; SKS (Same Key System) locks sold separately
VERSATILE DESIGN: Integrated cam lever allows you to adjust the upright position with ease; Rack also folds flat when you're not using it for better clearance and reduced drag
EASY INSTALL: Comes fully assembled out of the box; Tool-free installation in about 10 minutes; Refer to Yakima Fit My Car Tool to ensure compatibility

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
